summary: This document is an internal email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing unsolicited, bizarre emails from an individual named Jose Leon. The emails contain conspiracy-laden claims about video footage of extremists and traffickers in Wisconsin connected to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, and include links to photo albums. The correspondence is flagged as concerning and non-credible.

persons.name: Jose Leon
persons.context: Individual who sent multiple unsolicited emails to the U.S. Attorney's Office containing conspiracy theories about Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, including links to photo albums purportedly showing video footage of extremists and traffickers in Wisconsin.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned by Jose Leon in the email subject and body as being connected to alleged extremists and traffickers in Wisconsin.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned by Jose Leon in the email subject and body as being connected to alleged extremists and traffickers in Wisconsin, following her recent criminal charges.

events.title: Internal email about concerning communications
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel exchange emails discussing unsolicited, bizarre communications from Jose Leon following Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal charges.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was receiving 'mildly crazy emails and calls' following the criminal charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.
An individual named Jose Leon sent multiple unsolicited emails containing conspiracy theories about Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell being connected to extremists and traffickers in Wisconsin.
The emails included links to three Google Photos albums (with garbled 'hups://' URLs).
Internal correspondents characterized the sender as 'a little off' and 'a little nuts,' indicating the communications were not considered credible.
The correspondence shows the type of unsubstantiated tips and conspiracy theories that law enforcement may receive in high-profile cases.
